Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black band at junction of lip and body; on lip, lower part of lotus and connecting tendrils; on body, black-figure decoration consisting of Herakles wearing chiton, lion-skin and quiver, moving, to left with elbow raised high; with added red on skin.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.760 (B 601.41) and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1056.a.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0395) (Phase 1)
